error.msg: Redundant condition: The condition 'req_comp' is redundant since 'req_comp >= 3' is sufficient.

error.msg: Condition '!easy' is always true
error.verbose: Condition '!easy' is always true

error.msg: Condition 'len>128' is always true
error.verbose: Condition 'len>128' is always true

location.info: Assuming that condition 'len==128' is not redundant

error.msg: Condition 'g->transparent>=0' is always true

error.msg: C-style pointer casting
error.verbose: C-style pointer casting detected. C++ offers four different kinds of casts as replacements: static_cast, const_cast, dynamic_cast and reinterpret_cast. A C-style cast could evaluate to any of those automatically, thus it is considered safer if the programmer explicitly states which kind of cast is expected.
